text:
Colleague of mine does executive communications for a pretty impressive and growing group of people -- helping them write articles, pitching them for events, etc. She's looking for an editor to provide structural feedback/coaching for a few of her clients that need help to level of their writing.

Starting off, this would likely be around 3 hrs/week and $100/hr (this isn't set in stone, might be lower depending on experience, could also go higher for the right person). I'm helping facilitate intro's to a few people. If this is something you're interested in, send me a DM.

There's a huge preference for people who have...
1. experience ghostwriting for executives
2. experience writing for highly technical audiences (one her clients is a PhD working in the defense space)
3. have a track record of tier 1 placements in publications like HBR, MIT Technology Review, McKinsey Quarterly, etc.

Would be great if you could send along some links to your work. Thank you!!!

user_profile.real_name: Janessa Lantz, VP of Marketing at dbt Labs
user_profile.name: janessalantz
